abstracts.cdata!:
The Third Water Supply Project in
            Botswana was achieved. In general, the Bank performance was
            good. Of particular importance and benefit was the
            Bank's cooperation in accelerating the administrative
            processes at project commencement, and its willingness to
            provide retroactive financing relations between the Borrower
            and Beneficiary, the Consultants and the Bank were at all
            times excellent. The Borrower and Beneficiary the Water
            Utilities Corporation (WUC) is a small, highly efficient,
            compact organization with a dedicated staff determined to
            maintain the highest possible standards. In summary, the
            Project has met its physical goals, some progress has been
            made in management development, but the objectives were not
            clearly specified In numerical terms in the appraisal
            report. The Government of Botswana and WUC have fulfilled
            all the covenants under the Guarantee and Loan agreements.

18217904.owner: AFT: Water, Urban and Energy 1,AFT: Water, Urban and Energy 1

abstracts.cdata!:
The project would help avert the
            repetition, during the mid-1980's, of the current water
            shortages in Gaborone, Botswana's rapidly-developing
            capital, and help meet demand in Gaborone and the nearby
            meat-processing center of Lobatse until about 1988. It would
            also prepare for additional supply after that date. The
            project would: (i) raise the existing Gaborone Dam by 8 m;
            (ii) expand water treatment and transmission facilities;
            (iii) investigate the sites for two additional dams and
            prepare preliminary designs for the dams and associated
            plant; and (iv) help WUC develop a program for senior
            manpower development.
